intro: Margaritopsis nudiflora, commonly known as the naked-flower margaritopsis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white, five-petaled flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique floral structure, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
